text: Options are really cool because they let you trade a lot of different things. And one of those things is volatility. You can trade the behavior and the movement of a stock versus the price direction itself. And it provides another source of returns. What this is is we can see that starting typically about two weeks out before earnings, volatility implied volatility will start to expand. Both short-term and long-term. And then after the earnings release, typically speaking, we will see the volatility absolutely catastrophically contract.
